channel.title: Draft new configurations on DEV -- docs-nginx-com
channel.description: Recent content in Draft new configurations on DEV -- docs-nginx-com

item.title: Add a Staged Configuration
item.description:
Overview

This guide explains how to add a Staged Configuration to your NGINX One Console.

It takes time to set up NGINX configuration files. Staged Configurations can help. They work like a draft that uses the features of NGINX One Console. The Staged Configuration does not have to be valid. You can save your work before you push a configuration to an instance of NGINX.

With Staged Configurations, you can use these features of NGINX One Console:

item.title: View and edit a Staged Configuration
item.description:
Overview

This guide explains how to edit an existing Staged Configuration in your NGINX One Console.

It takes time to set up NGINX configuration files. Staged Configurations can help. They work like a draft that uses the features of NGINX One Console. The Staged Configuration does not have to be valid. You can save your work before you push a configuration to an instance of NGINX.

With Staged Configurations, you can use these features of NGINX One Console:

item.title: Import and export a Staged Configuration
item.description:
Overview

Many administrators do their work on local systems, virtual machines, Docker containers, and more. F5 NGINX One Console supports import and export of such configurations. This guide explains how to import or export a Staged Configuration to your NGINX One Console.

It takes time to set up NGINX configuration files. Staged Configurations can help. They work like a draft that uses the features of NGINX One Console. The Staged Configuration does not have to be valid. You can save your work before you push a configuration to an instance of NGINX.

item.title: Use the API to manage your Staged Configurations
item.description:
You can use F5 NGINX One Console API to manage your Staged Configurations. With our API, you can:

  • Create an NGINX Staged Configuration
    • The details allow you to add existing configuration files.
  • Get a list of existing Staged Configurations
    • Be sure to record the object_id of your target Staged Configuration for your analysis report.
  • Get an analysis report for an existing Staged Configuration
